question: [File: config/src/config/transaction_filters_config.rs] [Entire File] [Filter Application Overhead] Under high transaction throughput (100k+ TPS), can the overhead of calling is_enabled() and filter methods on every transaction cause performance bottlenecks? (Low)

[File: config/src/config/transaction_filters_config.rs] [Line: 36-43] [Hot Path Optimization] Are is_enabled() and filter reference getters optimized for the hot path, or do they involve unnecessary allocations or checks? (Low)

[File: config/src/config/transaction_filters_config.rs] [Entire File] [Config Clone Cost] When TransactionFiltersConfig is cloned across threads, does this involve expensive deep copies of all filter rules, impacting scalability? (Low)

[File: config/src/config/transaction_filters_config.rs] [Entire File] [Memory Footprint] Can large filter configurations with thousands of rules consume excessive memory, especially when replicated across multiple validator processes? (Low)

[File: config/src/config/transaction_filters_config.rs] [Entire File] [Cache Coherency] If filter configurations are cached in multiple locations, are cache invalidation mechanisms correct, or can stale configs be used? (Medium)

[File: config/src/config/transaction_filters_config.rs] [Entire File] [Censorship Resistance] Can transaction filters be abused by validators to censor specific users or transaction types, violating blockchain neutrality principles? (High)

[File: config/src/config/transaction_filters_config.rs] [Line: 13-17] [Selective Filtering] Can validators selectively enable filters only for certain components (e.g., api_filter but not consensus_filter) to accept censored transactions via consensus while blocking them via API? (High)

[File: config/src/config/transaction_filters_config.rs] [Entire File] [Filter Transparency] Are filter configurations publicly visible and auditable, or can validators hide their filtering criteria to covertly censor transactions? (Medium)

[File: config/src/config/transaction_filters_config.rs] [Entire File] [Emergency Filtering] Can emergency filter updates be deployed quickly in response to active attacks without requiring full node restarts or consensus, and does this create centralization risks? (Medium)

[File: config/src/config/transaction_filters_config.rs] [Entire File] [Filter Accountability] When transactions are filtered, is there sufficient logging and auditability to identify which filter rule triggered rejection and hold operators accountable? (Low)

[File: config/src/config/transaction_filters_config.rs] [Entire File] [Test Coverage] Are all code paths in TransactionFiltersConfig covered by tests, including edge cases like disabled filters, empty filters, and concurrent access? (Medium)

[File: config/src/config/transaction_filters_config.rs] [Entire File] [Integration Testing] Are there integration tests verifying filter consistency across all five filter types (api, consensus, execution, mempool, quorum_store) under realistic attack scenarios? (Medium)

[File: config/src/config/transaction_filters_config.rs] [Entire File] [Fuzzing Coverage] Has TransactionFiltersConfig been fuzzed with malformed configurations to discover deserialization vulnerabilities or panic conditions? (Medium)

[File: config/src/config/transaction_filters_config.rs] [Entire File] [Property Testing] Are there property-based tests ensuring invariants like 'enabled filter implies non-empty rules' and 'filter results are deterministic'? (Low)

[File: config/src/config/transaction_filters_config.rs] [Entire File] [Backward Compatibility] Are there tests ensuring new filter configuration versions can be deserialized by older node versions, preventing network partitions during upgrades? (High)

[File: config/src/config/transaction_filters_config.rs] [Line: 87 in node_config.rs] [NodeConfig Integration] When TransactionFiltersConfig is embedded in NodeConfig, can other config fields override or interact unexpectedly with filter configurations? (Medium)

[File: config/src/config/transaction_filters_config.rs] [Entire File] [Config Reload Safety] If NodeConfig is hot-reloaded to update filters, are there race conditions between reading old and new TransactionFiltersConfig that could cause inconsistent filtering? (High)

[File: config/src/config/transaction_filters_config.rs] [Entire File] [Config Validation Pipeline] Does the NodeConfig loading pipeline validate TransactionFiltersConfig internally consistent before applying it, or can invalid configs be loaded? (Medium)

[File: config/src/config/transaction_filters_config.rs] [Entire File] [Cross-Config Dependencies] Can conflicts between TransactionFiltersConfig and other NodeConfig fields (like ConsensusConfig, MempoolConfig) cause unexpected behavior? (Low)

[File: config/src/config/transaction_filters_config.rs] [Entire File] [Default Config Security] Does the default NodeConfig use secure TransactionFiltersConfig defaults, or does it leave filtering disabled, requiring explicit operator configuration? (Medium)

[File: config/src/config/transaction_filters_config.rs] [Entire File] [Filter Fingerprinting] Can attackers probe different validators with test transactions to fingerprint their filter configurations, then craft transactions that exploit the weakest filters? (Medium)

[File: config/src/config/transaction_filters_config.rs] [Entire File] [Timing Side Channels] Can timing differences in filter evaluation leak information about filter rules, allowing attackers to reverse-engineer filtering policies? (Low)

[File: config/src/config/transaction_filters_config.rs] [Line: 13-17] [Filter Evasion Chaining] Can attackers chain multiple evasion techniques across different filter types to achieve end-to-end bypass (e.g., bypass api_filter through encoding, mempool_filter through timing, consensus_filter through validator selection)? (High)

[File: config/src/config/transaction_filters_config.rs] [Entire File] [Configuration Poisoning] Can attackers with partial write access to config files inject malicious filter rules that gradually weaken security over time without immediate detection? (High)

[File: config/src/config/transaction_filters_config.rs] [Entire File] [Supply Chain Attack] Can compromised config management tools or deployment pipelines inject malicious filter configurations that are trusted because they come through official channels? (Medium)
